bestBHT.bht: In the face of upcoming challenges, Jesus encourages his followers to not be apprehensive or worried about what to say, for the Holy Spirit will guide and inspire them. This guidance extends beyond preaching to the defences they will have to make before councils and governors. Although they can rely on the Holy Spirit, there is still a need for diligent preparation and study. By casting their cares on the Father and trusting in His promised aid, they can face these trials with confidence, knowing that the Spirit's power will be displayed through them.

bhtAttempts.bht: When faced with the prospect of defending their faith, Jesus instructs his disciples in Mark 13:11 to not be filled with apprehension or worry about what to speak, for it is not they who will speak, but the Holy Spirit. This instruction is not limited to preaching, but also applies to the defences they must make before councils and governors. Jesus reassures them that the Holy Spirit will inspire their responses, providing the right words at the right time. However, this does not excuse laziness in preparation, as the reliance on the Holy Spirit must be coupled with diligent study and readiness. By casting their cares on the Father and relying on His promised aid, the disciples can face these challenges fearlessly, knowing that the power and majesty of the Spirit will be displayed through them.
